docs.text: in my reviews i try to make gentle recommendations rather than telling you what to see or what not to see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i realize that we all have different tastes and i cannot predict what my audience will like and what they will dislike .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but in the case of american beauty , i must make an exception .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you haven't yet seen it , go see it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: stop reading this review and head for your local multiplex , then after you've seen it , come back .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'll wait here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: welcome back .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you followed my advice ( and i see no reason why you should not have , do you ? ) ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'm sure you've just had one of the richest cinematic experiences of your life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: american beauty is an extraordinary film , a powerful , jolting exploration of the dark side of the american dream .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's humorous but it isn't funny because of the unrelenting ominous undercurrent that runs throughout the whole production .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mixing comedy and the darkest of drama was the way this film was intended , and by god , it works , making it one of the year's very best .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lester burnham ( kevin spacey ) has entered the mother of all mid-life crises .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is living life without a purpose .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is bored , depressed and sick of his sheltered , insignificant existence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he barely ever talks to his family , has no sex life , is stuck at a dead-end job and thinks he has no reason to live .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but one day , when he and his equally troubled wife ( annette bening ) attend one of his daughter's ( thora birch ) cheerleading performances , he sees something that makes him come alive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what he sees is the performance by his daughter's friend , the head cheerleader .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he develops a lust for the promiscuous young girl ; an obsession which soon becomes pedophilic in nature .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but for the first time , lester feels that he is actually living .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this crush is only the beginning .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lester proceeds to make more and more radical changes in his life , buying the car of his dreams , cursing off the boss and quitting his job ( " today i quit my job , told the boss to f * * * himself and blackmailed him for $60 , 000 -- would you pass the asparagus please ? " ) ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: buying drugs from the voyeur-next-door ( ricky fitts , a teenager who mysteriously videotapes what he considers to be " beauty " ) and refusing to be docile in family affairs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his new attitude further alienates his daughter , only reassuring her that her parents are nothing more than freaks of nature unjustly forced on her by the powers that be , and inspiring her to enter a relationship with her eccentric neighbor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and the burnhams's neighbors provide american beauty with a significant chunk of its dramatic momentum .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ricky fitts ( wes bentley ) serves as the film's thematic center , providing the obscure , powerful meaning of the title .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: colonel fitts , the father , is one of the most fascinating and complex characters in the movie , even considering his limited screentime .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kevin spacey has never been better , and this performance will certainly earn him a chance to put a little gold person on his mantel .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he never plays his droll character as a freak , rather , he effectively portrays him as a normal person led to drastic self-exploration by his dissatisfaction with life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: spacey is poignant and devastating in the role of a lifetime .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: equally astonishing is young thora birch , who plays her potentially stereotypical rebellious teen character with suprising feeling and tenderness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at two hours and ten minutes , american beauty didn't feel nearly long enough .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a complicated , unforgettable film that , like the ice storm two years ago , dares to explore the darkest reaches of suburban life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: powerfully and cynically , it dissects the notion of the pretty house with the white picket fence and appealing garden being the american dream .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it claims that this picture-perfect image is just that -- an image , and hiding behind it are lives much darker than common knowledge would have it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dark , deeply ironic ending , though given away by our narrator in the first few minutes of the movie , stays with you for weeks after it's all over .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: american beauty is just the kind of uncompromising film hollywood needs every now and then to counterbalance the mindless drivel we see released ; even more so considering it's a masterpiece .
docs.label: positive
